creator: alf@i100.no
text:
I set the name of my test plan to something different from the default "Test
Plan". I.e. I set the name of the "Test plan" node. Then I save my test plan,
and exit Jmeter.

Then I start Jmeter, and I open my saved test plan. If I now try to close the
test  plan, Jmeter tells me that something has changed, and that I asks me if I
want to save my changes.

I'll attach to test plans, both just containin the test plan element itself.
The first test plan has the default name "Test Plan". That test plan I can open
and close as many times I want in a Jmeter session without problems.
The second test plan hat the name "Another Name". That test plan I can open, but
whenever I try to close it, Jmeter thinks I have changed it.

I've looked a bit at the code, and the problem seems to be in the CheckDirty class.
I've been able to trace the problem to the following line in the CheckDirty
class, in the method addNode :
if (!previousGuiItems.get(treeNode).equals(treeNode.getTestElement())) {
What I observe, is that the treeNode.getName() returns "Another Name" and
previousGuiItems.get(treeNode)).getName() returns "Test Plan".

I do not know where the bug is, but it seems like the name of the item in the
hash map is not set correctly. I'm a bit unsure when the tree node for the root
of the testplan is made.

creator: alf@i100.no
text:
Created attachment 19677
Test plan with default name for the test plan node

This test plan you should be able to open and close as many times as you want

creator: alf@i100.no
text:
Created attachment 19678
Test plan with another name set for the test plan node

When you open this test plan, and then try to close it, or to open another test
plan, or try to exit Jmeter, you will get the dialog box stating that the test
plan has changed, and a question wether you want to save changes.

creator: alf@i100.no
text:
Note that this is somewhat related to bug 25441, which I was looking into.
I'm not sure if it is exactly the same problem, therefore I opened a new bug report.

This bug should be closed as fixed, since the changes applied in bug 25441
solves this problem.
creator: alf@i100.no
